attributes.comment:
I am writing to comment on the Notice of Proposed Rule Making in the Federal
Register published by U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services on February 1,
2007 that proposes to raise filing fees (docket number: USCIS-2006-0044). I
understand that you will be reviewing comments on this proposed rule before
sending the final proposal to the Office of Management and Budget.

I am writing to request reconsideration of the increase in filing fees for the I-600A
Petition to Classify an Orphan as an Immediate Relative and the biometrics fees
(fingerprinting). My husband and I are in the process of adopting internationally.
We sent our original I-600A to the CIS in August 2005, were fingerprinted, received
our approved 1-171H in November 2005, and submitted our dossier to China in
December 2005. When we started the adoption process, there was an 8-10 month
wait between dossier submission to the China Center of Adoption Affairs (CCAA)
and referral date. Now, the wait between dossier submission and referral is 16
months and travel to China usually occurs about 2 months later. In addition, the
time frame between dossier submission and referral is predicted to continue
increasing.

Because the I-171H expires 18 months after it is issued and fingerprint clearance
expires 15 months after completed, families are required to renew their fingerprint
clearance and their I-171H while they are waiting for a referral. This renewal
involves resubmitting an I-600A, refingerprinting, and repaying the filing fees.
Personally, we submitted our dossier 15 months ago and are waiting for a referral.
Even if we received a referral soon, our I-171H would expire before our travel would
be complete. Therefore, we applied for renewal of our I-171H by resubmitting the I-
600A, refingerprinting, and repaying the filing fee (currently $545 + 2 people
refingerprinting $140 = $685).

At the present time, the majority of international adoptions involve children from
China. Knowing that the I-171H has an 18 month expiration date, the fingerprint
clearance has a 15 month expiration date, and the time between dossier
submission and travel is increasing to beyond 18 months, this means the majority
of families adopting internationally will have to pay the filing fee for the I-600A and
fingerprinting twice. Rather than increasing the fee from $545 to $670 for the I-
1600A and from $70 to $80 for fingerprinting, I ask that when you consider
increasing the filing fees for the I-600A and the fingerprinting that you to
understand that this would really increase the fee to $1660 (2 submissions at
$670 + 2 sets of fingerprints at $80 for 2 adults). Increasing these fees places a
great burden on families who are adopting internationally. Thank you for
considering my comments.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Rachel B. Baker
